A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I forgot if I was watching Star Wars or a scene from Mary Poppins at some point. I can't believe the direction they took in several creative decisions throughout the movie. This movie rates worse than the Prequel Trilogy put together. It's as if they wanted to make a cool\, darker\, and more gritty movie like Rogue One\, but then someone came in with the editing hammer to ensure nothing sad or meaningful happens to any of your old favorties or your new favorites. Read the book for this\, it will piss you off a lot less.
